title: Continuous Line Shoe
prompt: Draw your shoe using one continuous line.
goal: Improve eye–hand coordination and careful observation.
howTo: Begin at any point on the shoe. Do not lift your pencil once you start. Move your eyes slowly along the edges and details and let your hand follow. If you feel stuck, slow down instead of stopping.

title: Blind Hand Drawing
prompt: Draw your hand without looking at your paper.
goal: Build trust between your eyes and your drawing hand.
howTo: Fix your eyes on your hand the entire time. Move your pencil slowly. Do not erase or correct.

title: Inside Spaces Only
prompt: Draw an object by showing only its inside spaces and shapes.
goal: Train your eye to see negative space instead of outlines.
howTo: Ignore the outer edge of the object. Focus on gaps, holes, and overlaps.

title: Upside-Down Object
prompt: Draw an object upside down.
goal: Slow down symbol-based drawing and increase accuracy.
howTo: Turn the object or image upside down and draw exactly what you see.

title: Close-Up Crop
prompt: Draw an object extremely close-up so only part of it fits on the page.
goal: Learn to crop boldly and focus on details.
howTo: Choose one small area and enlarge it until edges go off the page.

title: Memory First
prompt: Draw an object from memory, then look and add what you missed.
goal: Compare memory drawing with real observation.
howTo: Spend half the time drawing from memory, then observe carefully and add details.

title: Dot Observation
prompt: Draw an object using only dots.
goal: Slow down observation and mark placement.
howTo: Place dots close together for dark areas and farther apart for light areas.

title: Fast Then Slow
prompt: Draw the same object twice: once fast, once slow.
howTo: Use one side of the page for fast drawing and the other for slow.

title: Edge Study
prompt: Draw only the edges and corners of an object.
howTo: Ignore surfaces and textures. Look for turning points.

title: Shadow Shapes
prompt: Draw only the shadow shapes of an object.
goal: See form through light and shape without shading.
howTo: Outline the shadow shapes instead of the object itself.

title: Journey Line
prompt: Draw one line that travels across the page with a clear beginning, middle, and end.
goal: Practice visual storytelling using line alone.
howTo: Do not plan the whole path. Decide only the next small movement.

title: Line Conversation
prompt: Draw two lines that react to each other.
howTo: Alternate between the two lines. Let one lead and the other respond.

title: Maze Builder
prompt: Create a maze that grows as you draw it.
howTo: Start from one point and build slowly. Avoid erasing.

title: Edge Escape
prompt: Draw a line that tries to escape the edge of the paper.
howTo: Each time the line reaches the edge, redirect it back.

title: Weather Lines
prompt: Draw lines reacting to imaginary wind or rain.
howTo: Change direction and pressure as the weather changes.

title: Broken Path
prompt: Draw a path that breaks and reconnects.
howTo: Leave gaps intentionally, then reconnect later.

title: Crowded Space
prompt: Fill one area with many lines and leave another area empty.
howTo: Decide where density belongs before starting.

title: Spiral Growth
prompt: Draw a spiral that slowly changes shape.
howTo: Let the spiral stretch or tighten as it grows.

title: Mirror Lines
prompt: Draw a line and loosely mirror it beside itself.
howTo: Do not copy exactly—respond intuitively.

title: Material Lines
prompt: Draw lines that pretend to be rope, wire, or smoke.
howTo: Change pressure and rhythm to match the material.

title: Almost Falling
prompt: Draw a person about to fall but not yet falling.
howTo: Focus on body angle and foot placement. Skip facial details.

title: Heavy Carry
prompt: Draw a person carrying something very heavy.
howTo: Let the back bend and arms strain.

title: Running Late
prompt: Draw a person running because they are late.
howTo: Use long lines and forward tilt.

title: Quiet Steps
prompt: Draw someone trying to move quietly.
howTo: Use small steps and low posture.

title: Stretch Limit
prompt: Draw a person reaching just beyond their limit.
howTo: Stretch the body but keep it believable.

title: Pushing Door
prompt: Draw someone pushing open a heavy door.
howTo: Angle the body forward and brace the legs.

title: Pulling Back
prompt: Draw a person pulling something toward themselves.
howTo: Show tension in arms and shoulders.

title: Dodging
prompt: Draw someone dodging something fast.
howTo: Twist the body quickly.

title: Recovering
prompt: Draw a person recovering after a slip or fall.
howTo: Let the body wobble.

title: Climbing
prompt: Draw someone climbing over or onto something.
howTo: Use angled limbs and gripping hands.

title: Living Object
prompt: Draw an everyday object as if it were alive.
howTo: Start normal, then add posture or movement.

title: Secret Room
prompt: Draw a hidden room inside a familiar place.
howTo: Decide where the entrance is.

title: Helpful Creature
prompt: Draw a creature that helps with a small problem.
goal: Use imagination to solve a need.
howTo: Decide what problem it helps with first.

title: Impossible Tool
prompt: Design a tool that solves an impossible task.
howTo: Start with a real tool, then change one function.

title: Classroom Myth
prompt: Draw a myth or legend set in your classroom.
howTo: Use real classroom objects in the story.

title: Moving Furniture
prompt: Draw furniture that moves on its own.
howTo: Show how it moves.

title: Pocket World
prompt: Draw a tiny world that fits inside a pocket.
howTo: Include large and small elements together.

title: Invisible Thing
prompt: Draw something invisible by showing its effects.
howTo: Focus on what the invisible thing changes.

title: Future Object
prompt: Draw a common object from the future.
howTo: Keep its purpose recognizable.

title: Night Version
prompt: Draw a daytime object as it appears at night.
howTo: Use shapes and contrast instead of details.
